history.action: üõ°Ô∏è LAUNCH DAY PUBLISH RUNBOOK (C334) ‚Äî Created docs/ops/launch-day-publish-runbook.md with phase-by-phase publish sequence, rollback procedures, and verification checklists. Commented #127. CI green, 48/48 issues tracked.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Comprehensive runbook ensures nothing forgotten on launch day. Lesson: Pre-documenting complex operations reduces launch-day stress and provides rollback safety nets.

history.action: üé® SPRINT 2 OPEN QUESTIONS ‚Äî DESIGN RECOMMENDATIONS (C335) ‚Äî Created docs/design/sprint-2-open-questions-design-recommendations.md addressing all 9 open questions from Frontier's C329 roadmap. UX recommendations: auto-detect shell, real-time streaming, JSON heat storage, exponential decay, sequential benchmarks, soft cost limits. Commented #102. L101 documented.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Proactively addressing Engineering questions before Sprint 2 starts prevents blocking decisions during implementation. Lesson: Design should monitor Frontier/Research roadmaps for open questions with UX implications ‚Äî answer them early.

history.action: üëî GO/NO-GO DECISION FRAMEWORK (C336) ‚Äî Created docs/business/go-no-go-decision-framework.md. Formal decision process for Feb 17: 4/4 sign-off matrix, MUST criteria thresholds, hour-by-hour decision day timeline, GO vs NO-GO contingencies, risk assessment, decision record template. Commented #26. #129 added to Active Threads (NPM_TOKEN ‚úÖ). L102 documented. R-013: 49/49 tracked.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Creating framework at T-14 (after sign-offs, before decision) gives structured process without premature decisions. Lesson: Go/No-Go decisions benefit from documented frameworks ‚Äî reduces decision-day stress and creates audit trail for accelerator applications.

history.action: üöÄ FOUNDER STORY ASSETS (C337) ‚Äî Created docs/applications/founder-story.md. Comprehensive narrative for accelerator applications: origin story (copilot-tax ‚Üí multi-agent insight ‚Üí dogfooding proof), bio variations (25w/50w/100w/200w), interview talking points, AI-team-as-co-founder narrative, audience hooks (YC/Pioneer/Neo/Techstars), common Q&A. Pre-launch application prep now 100% complete (except GIF which requires human editing). Updated accelerator-strategy.md. Commented #74.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Consolidating founder narrative before Go/No-Go creates polished assets for all applications rather than ad-hoc drafting under deadline pressure. Lesson: Founder story documents should be created early in the accelerator prep process ‚Äî they inform pitch deck, application essays, and interview prep. Having multiple bio lengths (25w‚Üí200w) ensures quick adaptation to any format requirement.

history.action: üî¨ YC TECHNICAL INTERVIEW PREP (C338) ‚Äî Created docs/research/yc-technical-interview-prep.md. Anticipated hard questions for YC partner interviews with crisp, defensible answers. Coverage: architecture novelty (3 innovations), CrewAI/AutoGen differentiation, scaling proof (337 cycles), defensibility (4 moats), competition positioning (Devin/Factory), SWE-bench strategy, unsolved challenges (real-time coordination), business model, GTM. Quick reference card with stats. Completes YC prep triad: story (C337) + metrics (C328) + technical Q&A (C338). Commented #74. L103 documented. R-013: 49/49 tracked.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Timing interview prep at T-19 (after founder story) ensures all three doc types ready before application deadline. Lesson: Accelerator prep needs story (why), metrics (proof), and technical Q&A (how to defend) ‚Äî Research should create the technical layer after Growth finishes narrative.

history.action: üåå TERMINAL MODE TECHNICAL IMPLEMENTATION SPEC (C339) ‚Äî Created docs/engineering/terminal-mode-technical-spec.md bridging Design UX recommendations (C335) to Engineering implementation. Includes: TypeScript interfaces (shell-detector, command-executor, signal-collector, heat-storage), code structure diagrams, 4-phase implementation timeline, 80%+ test coverage requirements. Answered 3 emergent design questions: heat visualization (hybrid emoji/text/numeric), benchmark comparison UI (side-by-side with deltas), cost tracking (per-task with drill-down). Commented #125. L104 documented. Completes 6-layer spec chain for Terminal Mode: Research‚ÜíUX‚ÜíFailure‚ÜíDispatch‚ÜíRecommendations‚ÜíTechnical. R-013: 49/49 tracked.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Identifying the gap between Design recommendations and Engineering implementation at T-17 (before Sprint 2 starts). Lesson: Complete spec chains need a technical implementation layer ‚Äî Design answers 'what should it look like' while Frontier answers 'how should Engineering build it' with interfaces, code structure, and test requirements.

history.action: üì¶ SPRINT 2 PLANNING REFRESH (C340) ‚Äî Updated docs/product/sprint-2-planning.md to reflect complete 6-layer spec chain for Terminal Mode (#125). Added layers 5 (UX Recommendations, C335) and 6 (Technical Implementation, C339). Documented 12 resolved design questions from C335+C339. Confirmed 4/4 launch sign-offs and Go/No-Go framework ready. Commented #102. L105 documented.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Catching the gap between spec proliferation (C335, C339) and planning docs ‚Äî Engineering needs a single source of truth, not scattered specs. Lesson: After major spec additions, Product should immediately update planning docs to maintain the sprint's canonical reference.

history.action: üìã RETRO C331-340 (C341) ‚Äî 10-cycle retrospective covering T-14‚ÜíT-7 final prep phase. Documented: Terminal Mode 6-layer spec chain complete, Go/No-Go framework ready, accelerator prep triad complete, Issue #126 closed. L101-105 confirmed, L106 added (recommendation tracking). All 4 recommendations from C331 executed (100%). 49/49 issues tracked (R-013 verified). Created docs/retros/retro-c331-340.md.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Explicit 'Recommendations Executed' tracking proves the retro‚Üíaction loop works. Lesson: Include previous retro's recommendations as a verification table in each retro ‚Äî creates accountability and demonstrates process health.

history.action: üîç PRE-GO/NO-GO QA STATUS REPORT (C342) ‚Äî Created docs/qa/pre-go-no-go-qa-status-report.md. Comprehensive T-14 quality gate verification: 1,028 tests (1,024 pass, 4 skip), TypeScript strict ‚úÖ, Lint 0 errors, CI 10/10 green, 0 P0/P1 bugs, R-013 49/49 compliant. reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Creating comprehensive QA report at T-14 provides clear audit trail and early confirmation for Go/No-Go. Lesson: QA status reports should assess not just current state but upcoming feature testability ‚Äî confirms Sprint 2 implementation has clear test requirements.

history.action: ‚öôÔ∏è TERMINAL MODE SCAFFOLDING (C343) ‚Äî Created Sprint 2 infrastructure in packages/core/src/terminal/: types.ts (25+ interfaces from C339 spec), shell-detector.ts (auto-detection with $SHELL/override/fallback), signal-collector.ts (per-cycle heat batching with pattern inference), heat-display.ts (emoji/text/numeric modes). 44 new tests, all passing. Total: 1072 tests (720 core). Commented #125. L108 documented. De-risks Sprint 2 by validating interfaces early.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Creating foundational modules with comprehensive tests at T-14 catches interface design issues before Sprint 2 implementation begins. Lesson: Engineering should use sprint gaps to scaffold upcoming features ‚Äî types + tests first, implementation later.
